sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Texture Analyzer for measurement of mechanical and textural properties of pharmaceutical dosage forms including hardness, fracturability, adhesiveness, and elasticity.
sections.scope: Applicable to texture analysis activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Ensure the instrument is placed on a stable, level surface free from vibrations.
Power ON the texture analyzer and initialize the control software.
Allow the instrument to perform self-calibration and homing of the probe arm.
Verify that the load cell is properly installed and appropriate for expected force range.
Perform calibration using certified calibration weights to verify load cell accuracy.
Select and attach the appropriate probe or fixture based on the test requirement.
Set test parameters including test speed, target distance or force, and trigger force.
Configure data acquisition settings including sampling rate and test duration.
Prepare the sample and place it on the platform or in the fixture holder.
Ensure proper sample positioning and alignment under the probe.
Set the start position of the probe at an appropriate distance from the sample.
Initiate the test and allow the instrument to perform the programmed compression or penetration.
Monitor the force-distance or force-time curve during the test on the display.
After test completion, the probe returns to the start position automatically.
Remove the tested sample and prepare for the next replicate measurement.
Perform multiple replicates (typically 5-10) to ensure statistical validity.
Analyze the data to extract parameters such as hardness, work of penetration, or adhesiveness.
Export data and generate graphical plots for reporting purposes.
Clean the probe and platform after testing to remove any sample residue.
Document all test parameters, sample details, and results in the analytical record.
precautions: Select the appropriate load cell capacity to avoid overloading or damage.
Ensure the probe is securely attached to prevent detachment during testing.
Do not exceed the maximum load capacity of the load cell.
Ensure samples are properly positioned to avoid slippage during testing.
Use appropriate test speed suitable for the sample type.
Clean probes and fixtures thoroughly between different sample types.
Perform regular calibration to maintain accuracy of measurements.
Handle delicate probes carefully to avoid bending or damage.
Wear appropriate PPE when handling samples and cleaning equipment.
